title: Kirchhoff loop - R1 and R2 PDs when switch closes

content.description: In the circuit shown there are two identical batteries of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>∆ê</mi></math>, two resistors of resistances <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and a switch which is initially open. The switch is then closed. What effect, if any, does closing the switch have on the potential difference across each resistor?
content.question: Potential Difference Across <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>Potential Difference Across <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>ADoes not changeIncreasesBDoes not changeDecreasesCIncreasesIncreasesDIncreasesDecreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
